newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Marine fighter plane crashes in Atlantic.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Marine fighter plane crashes in Atlantic.

text.p: A U.S. Marine F/A-18 fighter attack plane crashed in the Atlantic off the Virginia coast on Thursday but there was no word on what happened to the pilot, official spokesmen said.
"We know that the plane is down," Gunnery Sergeant Don Hooper said.
He said the plane, which had taken off from Andrews Air Base near Washington, was in the ocean but there was no word on the pilot, who was alone.
Lieutenant Colonel Pat Sivigny said the Coast Guard was searching the area. He said the plane disappeared from radar near Wallops Island on the Virginia coast while on a routine air training flight.
